name: PAQA
summary:
The PocketStation is a Memory Card peripheral by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation home video game console. Categorized by Sony as a combination of a Memory Card and a miniature personal digital assistant, the device features a monochrome liquid crystal display (LCD), infrared communication capability, a real-time clock, built-in flash memory, and a sound capability. To use the device's memory card functionality, it must be connected to a PlayStation through a memory card slot. It was released exclusively in Japan on January 23, 1999.

Paqa tells the story of a little alien (Paqa) that crash into a japanese city of our planet and finds a Pocketstation, the gameplay is most a simulation game since the player will have to talk to the alien using the Pocketstation. The game makes a full use of the Pocketstation device and that makes that is not playable in any emulator...
